intro: Taeniophyllum trilobum, commonly known as the three-lobed moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, acrocarpous moss that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive morphology with a prostrate stem and dense, compact growth habit. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with three distinct lobes, giving it its common name. Taeniophyllum trilobum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions and plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its habitat.
